com.ssp.utils

Class ElementLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ssp.utils.ElementLayer

  • public class ElementLayer
extends java.lang.Object
    ElementLayer page is used to verify each page elements. We can declare and initialize this class on each page object classes

    • Method Detail

      • verifyPageElements

        public boolean verifyPageElements(java.util.List<java.lang.String> expectedElements,
                                  java.lang.Object obj)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Verify if expected page WebElements are present

        If expected element is present on the current page, add to list of value/fields to actualElement list and then compare to expectedElements

        Parameters:
        expectedElements - - expected WebElement values
        obj - - the page object the elements are on
        Returns:
        true if both the lists are equal, else returns false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - one of 4 possibilities

      • verifyPageElementsDoNotExist

        public boolean verifyPageElementsDoNotExist(java.util.List<java.lang.String> expectedNotToSee,
                                            java.lang.Object obj)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Verify the lack of presence of page WebElements

        If expected element is NOT present on this current page, add to list of value/fields to actualElement list and then compare to expectedElements

        Parameters:
        expectedNotToSee - - expected non-existing WebElement values
        obj - - the page object the elements should not be on
        Returns:
        true if both the lists are equal, else returns false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - one of 2 possibilities

      • verifyPageListElements

        public boolean verifyPageListElements(java.util.List<java.lang.String> expectedElements,
                                      java.lang.Object obj)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Verify if expected page List WebElements are present

        If size of the list element is greater than zero and first element from expected list elements present on the current page, add to list of value/fields to actualElement list and then compare to expectedElements

        Parameters:
        expectedElements - - expected List WebElement values
        obj - - the page object the elements are on
        Returns:
        true if both the lists are equal, else returns false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - one of 5 possibilities
